\n<Alain>Nice, that should be all the junk
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Hm? That flash... Oh, so ended up finishing, Sir
\n<Guild Master Bryn>... Not bad... Though do you expect me to clean up
the mess that you shoved onto the ground?
\n<Guild Master Bryn>I'm simply joking. You did a good job, so let
me go ahead and reward you then.
\n<Guild Master Bryn>... Hmm... I was sure I put your reward
here somewhere. It should in the box down here, right?
\n<Alain>... Well... I guess this is a reward in
its own right to some people...
\n<Alain>This whole chair could be taken up by
that massive butt, so it's as intimidating
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Here, as you can see, Sir Alain, your materials.
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Oh, you seem a little flustered. I was
simply turning around. Were you scared I'd sit on you
\n<Alain>You seem to be having a bit too much fun
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Sorry, I couldn't help myself. I've been so
swamped in paperwork, you made the perfect outlet to
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Please feel free to help me out with this again.
We get guests every so often, so we need to keep these
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Also, as a bonus just this one time, I
prepared a lovely item just for someone of your scale.
The chairs in the Guild Master's Office are now free
More importantly, the Guild Master seems to have been
happy sneaking glimpses of Alain's struggles!
\nr<Ritia>Guild Master, I'm here to make my report for today.

\nr<Ritia>Well, I guess I'll have to wait for her to finish

\n<Alain>Blasted! I was too slow. Ritia came in

\n<Guild Master Bryn>Hm...? Oh, I'm sorry, Ritia. I didn't hear you
come in. Is it time for your daily report?
\nr<Ritia>Oh, you finally noticed me, Guild Master. Yes, let
me stand up and get started then.
\nr<Ritia>Here's the compiled report for the adventurers who
came by today as well as the quests they took and the
\nr<Ritia>Also, here's a separate report about Gale and Alain
which I took the liberty of making.
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Gale and Alain? You sure are worried about the

\nr<Ritia>...?! No way. I miss how easy it was to laze

\n<Guild Master Bryn>My lips are sealed. Ufufu~! (... Alain?)

\n<Guild Master Bryn>(Well, he was only working on one simple job so

Unable to finish cleaning the chairs before the meeting
began, Dragon Rider Alain was unable to escape when
In an instant, he was crushed unaware beneath tons upon
tons of weight by the guild receptionist.
As the receptionist gave her daily report to the Guild
Master, she was unaware that the red stain beneath her
rear was the adventurer she was talking about.
\nr<Iora>Guild Master, it's time we talk about the materials

\nr<Iora>Oh my. Busy as ever, I see. That stack of papers

\n<Guild Master Bryn>Ah! I was having him clean up the chairs before

\nr<Iora>This is not something you can dismiss with just
\n<Guild Master Bryn>... Are you sure you should be telling me that?

\nr<Iora>A Revival Potion for Alain is cheaper than my

\n<Guild Master Bryn>... Out of curiosity, how much did you purchase
Unable to finish cleaning the chairs before the meeting
began, Dragon Rider Alain was unable to escape when
In an instant, he was crushed unaware beneath tons upon
tons of weight by the guild shop clerk and immediately
became a stain on her new panties.
Though the guild could revive him later, the cost of
Iora's panties was added to his debt... Which was far
more than even the Guild Master had expected.
\nr<Adventurer>Hey, Guild Master. You wanted to see me?
\nr<Adventurer>Oh boy, guess I should just wait. She looks
\nr<Adventurer>I guess I'll take a seat then.
\n<Alain>Blasted! I was too slow. Somebody came
\n<Alain>Wait! I'm down here! Don't sit dow-!
\nr<Adventurer>... Hm... This seat's kind of uncomfortable.
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Hm...? Oh, my apologizes. I got lost in my
work for a moment there. Are you here for a meeting?
\nr<Adventurer>You're the one who called me in.
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Oh, that's right. We need to talk about your
promotion exam since you've racked up the achievements
needed to go up a rank.
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Let's see... Where did I put the parchment
that discussed that... Here it is.
\nr<Adventurer>I have? Awesome! Let me see that paper!
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Take it easy there. Your promotion isn't going
anywhere. Here, read the details for yourself.
\nr<Adventurer>Silver Rank? That's great! What do I have to do?
\n<Guild Master Bryn>The exam should be in two weeks. We'll have an
official test of our skills during that time, so you
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Congratulations, Miss, but do not let your guard
down this early. You haven't passed yet.
\n<Guild Master Bryn>Many adventurers go missing for getting too
reckless without any preparation and thought, so we
want to make sure you aren't one of them.
\n<Guild Master Bryn>(Speaking of which... If this girl barged in,
that means Sir Alain didn't finish his job in time...)
\n<Guild Master Bryn>(Oh dear... I was so focused on my work that
\n<Guild Master Bryn>(Well, he should still be around and safe, right?)
